profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 17:12:21 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Archives of American art does not own the original papers. Use is limited to the microfilm copy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters, mostly from French artists, regarding their paintings, many of which are to be shown at an exhibit at the Palais de Champs Elys√©es organized by the staff of Goupil & Cie.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reel N11 (frames 789-999) available for use at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: Originals in the New York Public Library, Manuscript Division.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Paris, France. Firm succeeded by Knoedler and Company.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Microfilmed 1956 by the Archives of American Art with other art-related papers in the Manuscript Division of the New York Public Library. Included in the microfilming project were selected papers of the Art Division and the Prints Division.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: List of correspondents available at Archives of American Art offices, filed New York Public Library, Manuscript Division.
